text: Differential interaction of nuclear factors with the leukocyte - specific <extra_id_0> pp52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in B and T cells .

The leukocyte - specific , cytoskeleton - binding <extra_id_0> pp52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LSP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> WP-34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) protein is widely expressed in multiple leukocyte lineages , including B and T lymphocytes , granulocytes , and macrophages .
We previously detected a tissue - specific promoter preceding the exon encoding the N terminus of the <extra_id_0> pp52 leukocyte protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Here we describe the functional characterization of this promoter and identification of the factors in B and T cells that regulate its activity .

The <extra_id_0> pp52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter contains an initiator specifying the unique 5' terminus of <extra_id_0> pp52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , tandem pairs of Ets and SP1 motifs , and a lone C/EBP motif .

text: All these motifs are essential and collectively control transcriptional activity .
DNA binding studies and Ab supershift assays revealed that different combinations of factors interact with these motifs in B cells vs T cells .

The Ets motifs are preferentially bound by <extra_id_0> PU-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in B cell extracts from all stages of development , whereas a different Ets family member reacts with these motifs in T cell extracts .

The C / EBP motif is bound by <extra_id_0> Ig/EBP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in pre-B cell and T cell extracts , but is replaced by <extra_id_0> nuclear factor-IL-6beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or a <extra_id_0> nuclear factor-IL-6beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> Ig/EBP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimer in plasmacytoma cell extracts .

text: Despite its reported role as a negative regulator of transcription , <extra_id_0> Ig/EBP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears to exert a stimulatory effect on this promoter .

These findings reveal the features controlling the <extra_id_0> pp52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in B and T cells and provide the foundation for determining the regulation of this promoter in other leukocyte lineages .
